annotation.tai_utc_difference: [Value of TAI-UTC at time of first record]
annotation.comment: Time of measurement in seconds in the UTC time scale since 1 Jan 2000 00:00:00 UTC. [tai_utc_difference] is the difference between TAI and UTC reference time (seconds) for the first measurement of the data set. If a leap second occurs within the data set, the attribute leap_second is set to the UTC time at which the leap second occurs.

annotation.tai_utc_difference: [Value of TAI-UTC at time of first record]
annotation.comment: Time of measurement in seconds in the TAI time scale since 1 Jan 2000 00:00:00 TAI. This time scale contains no leap seconds. The difference (in seconds) with time in UTC is given by the attribute [time:tai_utc_difference].
Latitude of measurement [-80,80]. Positive latitude is North latitude, negative latitude is South latitude.
Longitude of measurement. East longitude relative to Greenwich meridian.

annotation.standard_name: sea surface height above reference ellipsoid
annotation.comment: Fully corrected sea surface height measured by KaRIn. The height is relative to the reference ellipsoid defined in the global attributes. This value is computed using radiometer measurements for wet troposphere effects on the KaRIn measurement (e.g., rad_wet_tropo_cor and sea_state_bias_cor).
1-sigma uncertainty on the sea surface height from the KaRIn measurement.
Sea surface height anomaly from the KaRIn measurement = ssh_karin - mean_sea_surface_cnescls - solid_earth_tide - ocean_tide_fes – internal_tide_hret - pole_tide - dac.

annotation.standard_name: sea surface height above reference ellipsoid
annotation.comment: Fully corrected sea surface height measured by KaRIn. The height is relative to the reference ellipsoid defined in the global attributes. This value is computed using model-based estimates for wet troposphere effects on the KaRIn measurement (e.g., model_wet_tropo_cor and sea_state_bias_cor_2).
Sea surface height anomaly from the KaRIn measurement = ssh_karin_2 - mean_sea_surface_cnescls - solid_earth_tide - ocean_tide_fes – internal_tide_hret - pole_tide - dac.
Quality flag for the SSHA from KaRIn.

annotation.long_name: polarization for each side of the KaRIn swath
annotation.comment: H denotes co-polarized linear horizontal, V denotes co-polarized linear vertical.
Significant wave height from KaRIn volumetric correlation.

annotation.long_name: 1-sigma uncertainty on significant wave height from KaRIn
annotation.comment: 1-sigma uncertainty on significant wave height from KaRIn.

annotation.long_name: normalized radar cross section (sigma0) from KaRIn
annotation.comment: Normalized radar cross section (sigma0) from KaRIn in real, linear units (not decibels). The value may be negative due to noise subtraction. The value is corrected for instrument calibration and atmospheric attenuation. Radiometer measurements provide the atmospheric attenuation (sig0_cor_atmos_rad).
1-sigma uncertainty on sigma0 from KaRIn.

annotation.long_name: normalized radar cross section (sigma0) from KaRIn
annotation.comment: Normalized radar cross section (sigma0) from KaRIn in real, linear units (not decibels). The value may be negative due to noise subtraction. The value is corrected for instrument calibration and atmospheric attenuation. A meteorological model provides the atmospheric attenuation (sig0_cor_atmos_model).
Wind speed from KaRIn computed from sig0_karin.
Wind speed from KaRIn computed from sig0_karin_2.

annotation.long_name: quality flag for significant wave height from KaRIn.
annotation.comment: Quality flag for significant wave height from KaRIn.

annotation.long_name: quality flag for sigma0 from KaRIn.
annotation.comment: Quality flag for sigma0 from KaRIn.
Number of native unsmoothed, beam-combined KaRIn samples averaged.

annotation.long_name: significant wave height from wave model
annotation.source: European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts
annotation.comment: Significant wave height from model.
Mean sea surface wave direction.

annotation.long_name: sea surface wind wave mean period
annotation.comment: Sea surface wind wave mean period from model spectral density second moment.

annotation.source: European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts
annotation.comment: Eastward component of the atmospheric model wind vector at 10 meters.

annotation.source: European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts
annotation.comment: Northward component of the atmospheric model wind vector at 10 meters.
Wind speed from radiometer measurements.
Approximate distance to the nearest coast point along the Earth surface.
Approximate compass heading (0-360 degrees with respect to true north) to the nearest coast point.

annotation.flag_meanings: open_ocean land continental_water aquatic_vegetation continental_ice_snow floating_ice salted_basin
annotation.comment: 7-state surface type classification computed from a mask built with MODIS and GlobCover data.

annotation.source: EUMETSAT Ocean and Sea Ice Satellite Applications Facility
annotation.comment: Dynamic ice flag for the location of the KaRIn measurement.
Flag indicates that signal is attenuated, probably from rain.

Flag indicating the validity and type of processing applied to generate the wet troposphere correction (rad_wet_tropo_cor). A value of 0 indicates that open ocean processing is used, a value of 1 indicates coastal processing, and a value of 2 indicates that rad_wet_tropo_cor is invalid due to land contamination.
Altitude of the KMSF origin.
Geodetic latitude [-80,80] (degrees north of equator) of the satellite nadir point.
Longitude (degrees east of Grenwich meridian) of the satellite nadir point.

annotation.long_name: orbital altitude rate with respect to mean sea surface
annotation.comment: Orbital altitude rate with respect to the mean sea surface.
Angle with respect to true north of the cross-track direction to the right of the spacecraft velocity vector.
KMSF attitude roll angle; positive values move the +y antenna down.
KMSF attitude pitch angle; positive values move the KMSF +x axis up.

KMSF attitude yaw angle relative to the nadir track. The yaw angle is a right-handed rotation about the nadir (downward) direction. A yaw value of 0 deg indicates that the KMSF +x axis is aligned with the horizontal component of the Earth-relative velocity vector. A yaw value of 180 deg indicates that the spacecraft is in a yaw-flipped state, with the KMSF -x axis aligned with the horizontal component of the Earth-relative velocity vector.

annotation.long_name: heading of the spacecraft Earth-relative velocity vector
annotation.comment: Angle with respect to true north of the horizontal component of the spacecraft Earth-relative velocity vector. A value of 90 deg indicates that the spacecraft velocity vector pointed due east. Values between 0 and 90 deg indicate that the velocity vector has a northward component, and values between 90 and 180 deg indicate that the velocity vector has a southward component.
Orbit quality flag.

annotation.long_name: weighted average latitude of samples used to compute SSH
annotation.comment: Latitude of measurement [-80,80]. Positive latitude is North latitude, negative latitude is South latitude. This value may be biased away from a nominal grid location if some of the native, unsmoothed samples were discarded during processing.

annotation.long_name: weighted average longitude of samples used to compute SSH
annotation.comment: Longitude of measurement. East longitude relative to Greenwich meridian. This value may be biased away from a nominal grid location if some of the native, unsmoothed samples were discarded during processing.
Distance of sample from nadir. Negative values indicate the left side of the swath, and positive values indicate the right side of the swath.

annotation.long_name: radiometric calibration X factor as a composite value for the X factors of the +y and -y channels
annotation.comment: Radiometric calibration X factor as a linear power ratio.

annotation.long_name: two-way atmospheric correction to sigma0 from model
annotation.source: European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts
annotation.comment: Atmospheric correction to sigma0 from weather model data as a linear power multiplier (not decibels). sig0_cor_atmos_model is already applied in computing sig0_karin_2.

annotation.long_name: two-way atmospheric correction to sigma0 from radiometer data
annotation.comment: Atmospheric correction to sigma0 from radiometer data as a linear power multiplier (not decibels). sig0_cor_atmos_rad is already applied in computing sig0_karin.
Doppler centroid (in hertz or cycles per second) estimated by KaRIn.

annotation.long_name: height of reference surface used for phase bias calculation
annotation.comment: Height (relative to the reference ellipsoid) of the reference surface used for phase bias calculation during L1B processing.

annotation.long_name: height of reference surface used by on-board-processor
annotation.comment: Height (relative to the reference ellipsoid) of the reference surface used by the KaRIn on-board processor.

annotation.long_name: radiometer main beam brightness temperature at 18.7 GHz
annotation.comment: Main beam brightness temperature measurement at 18.7 GHz. Value is unsmoothed (along-track averaging has not been performed).

annotation.long_name: radiometer main beam brightness temperature at 23.8 GHz
annotation.comment: Main beam brightness temperature measurement at 23.8 GHz. Value is unsmoothed (along-track averaging has not been performed).

annotation.long_name: radiometer main beam brightness temperature at 34.0 GHz
annotation.comment: Main beam brightness temperature measurement at 34.0 GHz. Value is unsmoothed (along-track averaging has not been performed).
Integrated water vapor content from radiometer measurements.
Integrated cloud liquid water content from radiometer measurements.
Mean sea surface height above the reference ellipsoid. The value is referenced to the mean tide system, i.e. includes the permanent tide (zero frequency).
Accuracy of the mean sea surface height (mean_sea_surface_cnescls).
Mean sea surface height above the reference ellipsoid. The value is referenced to the mean tide system, i.e. includes the permanent tide (zero frequency).
Accuracy of the mean sea surface height (mean_sea_surface_dtu)
Geoid height above the reference ellipsoid with a correction to refer the value to the mean tide system, i.e. includes the permanent tide (zero frequency).
Mean dynamic topography above the geoid.
Accuracy of the mean dynamic topography.
Ocean depth or land elevation above reference ellipsoid. Ocean depth (bathymetry) is given as negative values, and land elevation positive values.

annotation.source: Cartwright and Taylor (1971) and Cartwright and Edden (1973)
annotation.comment: Solid-Earth (body) tide height. The zero-frequency permanent tide component is not included.
Geocentric ocean tide height. Includes the sum total of the ocean tide, the corresponding load tide (load_tide_fes) and equilibrium long-period ocean tide height (ocean_tide_eq).
Geocentric ocean tide height. Includes the sum total of the ocean tide, the corresponding load tide (load_tide_got) and equilibrium long-period ocean tide height (ocean_tide_eq).
Geocentric load tide height. The effect of the ocean tide loading of the Earth's crust. This value has already been added to the corresponding ocean tide height value (ocean_tide_fes).
Geocentric load tide height. The effect of the ocean tide loading of the Earth's crust. This value has already been added to the corresponding ocean tide height value (ocean_tide_got).
Equilibrium long-period ocean tide height. This value has already been added to the corresponding ocean tide height values (ocean_tide_fes and ocean_tide_got).

Non-equilibrium long-period ocean tide height. This value is reported as a relative displacement with repsect to ocean_tide_eq. This value can be added to ocean_tide_eq, ocean_tide_fes, or ocean_tide_got, or subtracted from ssha_karin and ssha_karin_2, to account for the total long-period ocean tides from equilibrium and non-equilibrium contributions.
Coherent internal ocean tide. This value is subtracted from the ssh_karin and ssh_karin_2 to compute ssha_karin and ssha_karin_2, respectively.
Coherent internal tide.

Geocentric pole tide height. The total of the contribution from the solid-Earth (body) pole tide height, the ocean pole tide height, and the load pole tide height (i.e., the effect of the ocean pole tide loading of the Earth's crust).

Model estimate of the effect on sea surface topography due to high frequency air pressure and wind effects and the low-frequency height from inverted barometer effect (inv_bar_cor). This value is subtracted from the ssh_karin and ssh_karin_2 to compute ssha_karin and ssha_karin_2, respectively. Use only one of inv_bar_cor and dac.

annotation.long_name: static inverse barometer effect on sea surface height
annotation.comment: Estimate of static effect of atmospheric pressure on sea surface height. Above average pressure lowers sea surface height. Computed by interpolating ECMWF pressure fields in space and time. The value is included in dac. To apply, add dac to ssha_karin and ssha_karin_2 and subtract inv_bar_cor.

annotation.source: European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts
annotation.comment: Equivalent vertical correction due to dry troposphere delay. The reported sea surface height, latitude and longitude are computed after adding negative media corrections to uncorrected range along slant-range paths, accounting for the differential delay between the two KaRIn antennas. The equivalent vertical correction is computed by applying obliquity factors to the slant-path correction. Adding the reported correction to the reported sea surface height results in the uncorrected sea surface height.

annotation.long_name: wet troposphere vertical correction from weather model data
annotation.source: European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts
annotation.comment: Equivalent vertical correction due to wet troposphere delay from weather model data. The reported pixel height, latitude and longitude are computed after adding negative media corrections to uncorrected range along slant-range paths, accounting for the differential delay between the two KaRIn antennas. The equivalent vertical correction is computed by applying obliquity factors to the slant-path correction. Adding the reported correction to the reported sea surface height (ssh_karin_2) results in the uncorrected sea surface height.

annotation.long_name: wet troposphere vertical correction from radiometer data
annotation.comment: Equivalent vertical correction due to wet troposphere delay from radiometer measurements. The reported pixel height, latitude and longitude are computed after adding negative media corrections to uncorrected range along slant-range paths, accounting for the differential delay between the two KaRIn antennas. The equivalent vertical correction is computed by applying obliquity factors to the slant-path correction. Adding the reported correction to the reported sea surface height (ssh_karin) results in the uncorrected sea surface height.

Equivalent vertical correction due to ionosphere delay. The reported sea surface height, latitude and longitude are computed after adding negative media corrections to uncorrected range along slant-range paths, accounting for the differential delay between the two KaRIn antennas. The equivalent vertical correction is computed by applying obliquity factors to the slant-path correction. Adding the reported correction to the reported sea surface height results in the uncorrected sea surface height.
Height correction from KaRIn crossover calibration. To apply this correction the value of height_cor_xover should be added to the value of ssh_karin, ssh_karin_2, ssha_karin, and ssha_karin_2.
Quality flag for corrections.

annotation.source: European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts
annotation.comment: Rain rate from weather model.

annotation.source: EUMETSAT Ocean and Sea Ice Satellite Applications Facility
annotation.comment: Concentration of sea ice from model.

annotation.long_name: sea state bias correction to height
annotation.comment: Sea state bias correction to ssh_karin. Adding the reported correction to the reported sea surface height results in the uncorrected sea surface height. The wind_speed_karin value is used to compute this quantity.

annotation.long_name: sea state bias correction to height
annotation.comment: Sea state bias correction to ssh_karin_2. Adding the reported correction to the reported sea surface height results in the uncorrected sea surface height. The wind_speed_karin_2 value is used to compute this quantity.

annotation.long_name: SWH used in sea state bias correction
annotation.comment: Significant wave height used in sea state bias correction.

annotation.description: NetCDF-4 conventions adopted in this file. This attribute should be set to CF-1.7 to indicate that the file is compliant with the Climate and Forecast NetCDF conventions.
Level 2 Low Rate Sea Surface Height Data Product - Expert SSH with Wind and Wave
Name of producing agency.

The method of production of the original data. If it was model-generated, source should name the model and its version, as specifically as could be useful. If it is observational, source should characterize it (e.g., 'Ka-band radar interferometer').
UTC time when file generated. Format is: 'YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ : Creation'
Published or web-based references that describe the data or methods used to product it. Provides version number of software generating product.
Name and version of Product Description Document to use as reference for product.
Contact information for producer of product. (e.g., 'ops@jpl.nasa.gov').
Cycle number of the product granule.
Pass number of the product granule.
UTC time of the first equator crossing in product. Format is YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.ssssssZ
Longitude of the first equator crossing in product (degrees)
Composite release identifier (CRID) of the data system used to generate this file
Version identifier of this data file
Name of the product generation executable (PGE) that created this file
Version identifier of the product generation executable (PGE) that created this file
UTC time of first measurement. Format is: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.ssssssZ
UTC time of last measurement. Format is: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.ssssssZ
Westernmost longitude (deg) of granule bounding box
Easternmost longitude (deg) of granule bounding box
Southernmost latitude (deg) of granule bounding box
Northernmost latitude (deg) of granule bounding box
Nominal swath corner longitude for the first range line and left edge of the swath (degrees_east)
Nominal swath corner latitude for the first range line and left edge of the swath (degrees_north)
Nominal swath corner longitude for the last range line and left edge of the swath (degrees_east)
Nominal swath corner latitude for the last range line and left edge of the swath (degrees_north)
Nominal swath corner longitude for the first range line and right edge of the swath (degrees_east)
Nominal swath corner latitude for the first range line and right edge of the swath (degrees_north)
Nominal swath corner longitude for the last range line and right edge of the swath (degrees_east)
Nominal swath corner latitude for the last range line and right edge of the swath (degrees_north)
Wavelength (m) of the transmitted signal, which is determined based on the transmitter center frequency of the transmit chirp.
Flag indicating which of the KaRIn antennas (plus_y or minus_y) is transmitting.
Name of input Level 1B low rate interferogram file.
Names of input Level 2 nadir altimeter (interim) geophysical data record files.
Names of input Level 2 radiometer (interim) geophysical data record files.
Name of input low rate crossover calibration file.
Names of input static KaRIn calibration files.
Name of input Level 2 low rate precalibration sea surface height processor configuration parameters file.
Name of input orbit ephemeris file.
Names of input reference orbit track files.
Names of input meteorological model surface pressure files.
Names of input meteorological model wet troposphere files.
Names of input meteorological model wind speed files.
Names of input global ionosphere map (GIM) files.
Name of input pole location file.
Names of input dynamic atmosphere correction files.
Names of input precipitation model files.
Names of input sea ice mask model files.
Names of input wave model files.

Version number of geophysical and environmental corrections static database. Provides models for surface classification, digital elevation (land) and bathymetry, geoid, mean sea surface, mean dynamic topography, ocean tides, load tides, pole tide, internal tides, monthly and diurnal atmospheric pressure climatology, sea state bias.
Semi-major axis of reference ellipsoid in meters.
Flattening of reference ellipsoid
